images.title: Image Sources
images.description: Array of image sources. Each can be an HTTP(S) URL or a key-value store reference in format: key-value://{storeId}/{key}
images.sectionDescription: Provide URLs to images you want to process. You can also reference images stored in Apify key-value stores using the key-value:// format.

width.title: Target Width
width.description: Target width in pixels. If not specified, width is determined automatically.
width.sectionDescription: Configure the output size of your processed images.

height.title: Target Height
height.description: Target height in pixels. If not specified, height is determined automatically.

fit.title: Fit Mode
fit.description: How the image should be resized to fit the target dimensions. Cover: crop to fill. Contain: letterbox to fit. Inside: resize within bounds. Outside: resize to cover bounds. Fill: stretch to exact dimensions.

position.title: Crop Position
position.description: Position for smart cropping when using cover or contain fit modes.

format.title: Output Format
format.description: Target image format. Select 'original' to keep the source format.
format.sectionDescription: Configure the output format and compression settings.

quality.title: Quality
quality.description: Quality setting for lossy formats (JPEG, WebP, AVIF). Higher values produce better quality but larger files.

background.title: Background Color
background.description: Background color for padding when using contain or fill modes. Supports hex colors (e.g., #ffffff) or CSS color names.

stripMetadata.title: Strip Metadata
stripMetadata.description: Remove EXIF and other metadata from images to reduce file size.

concurrency.title: Concurrency
concurrency.description: Maximum number of images to process in parallel.

outputStoreId.title: Output Key-Value Store ID
outputStoreId.description: ID of the key-value store where processed images will be saved. Leave empty to use the default store.

createDataset.title: Create Dataset Records
createDataset.description: When enabled, creates a dataset record for each processed image with metadata and public URLs.
